justification: A-centric and lopsided. It asks B to give up a Tier 1 RB and a preferred dual-threat QB for a Tier 4 pocket QB, a WR2, and an injured Tier 4 RB—misaligned with B’s urgent need to win and upside preferences. It ignores B’s values (dual-threat QBs, big-play upside) and playoff-slate thinking. It also conflicts with A’s stated preference for pocket passers. The rationale is generic and doesn’t address B’s incentives or constraints.
